intro: Baccharis bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá baccharis, is a shrub native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its woody stems and dense foliage make it a common component of dry shrublands. Baccharis bogotensis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife and preventing soil erosion.
